thread.title: Phillip Schofield advices Jeremy McConnell not to sign Stephanie Davis’s ‘unreasonable’ contract trying to silence him from speaking about ‘their’ baby
thread.title_full: Phillip Schofield advices Jeremy McConnell not to sign Stephanie Davis’s ‘unreasonable’ contract trying to silence him from speaking about ‘their’ baby

author: jrobinson
title: Phillip Schofield advices Jeremy McConnell not to sign Stephanie Davis’s ‘unreasonable’ contract trying to silence him from speaking about ‘their’ baby
text:
TV Magazine 'I wouldn't sign it' Phillip Schofield advices Jeremy McConnell not to sign Stephanie Davis’s ‘unreasonable’ contract trying to silence him from speaking about ‘their’ baby 
This Morning host didn't hold back during chat with Irish model on Wednesday's show By JILL ROBINSON, SHOWBIZ REPORTER 8th February 2017, 11:08 am Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments PHILLIP Schofield has advised Jeremy McConnell NOT to sign a legal document issued by his ex Stephanie Davis to try and gag him from speaking their baby son. 
The Irish model appeared on Wednesday’s This Morning to discuss his ongoing paternity battle with the former Hollyoaks star after she gave birth to son Caben-Albi last month. ITV Phillip Schofield told Jeremy McConnell he shouldn’t sign a contract issued by his ex Stephanie Davis ITV 2 Jeremy wants to know if he is the father of Stephanie’s baby 
But after the 23-year-old issued her ex with a legal document which would stop him talking about the outcome of any DNA test, Phillip told Jeremy he shouldn’t sign it. 
He said: “If it were me I wouldn’t sign it. The word I would use is unreasonable. In my eyes it has an impact on your entire life.”
